sourceDesc.p: Extract (3rd person) in Christie’s catalogue, November 2001; MS 1 p.; addressed Mr. Lilwall; dated Tavistock House, 3 February 1855.

body.p: Regretting that he cannot have the pleasure of complying with the request of the Early Closing Association,The Early Closing Association, based at 35 Ludgate Hill, London, aimed to reduce “within reasonable limits” the hours of employment in industrial life, which included offices, banks and the wholesale trade, besides manufactures. In freeing evening hours for recreation and self-instruction, the Association stressed educational and moral development. See To Hugh Evans, 3 March 1851. as all the public engagements of that nature he had leisure to make during the present year, are already made.
